overview: In our society which is highly patriarchal and male-dominated, the issue of male child sexual abuse gets overlooked and neglected.  Through the stories of some male survivors of sexual abuse, the film 'Gandi Baat' sensitively highlights the issue and attempts to break the taboo and silence surrounding it.  Shivpriy Alok, the director of the film, is a Delhi based film-maker and writer. He started his professional journey with working in a news channel in 2013. After few months working there, he moved to Mumbai and started working as an assistant director in daily soaps. He has also been doing poetry and script-writing for advertisement films. Being a child abuse survivor, he experienced the pain of negligence towards distressed boys in society and that pain drove him to make his first documentary ‘Gandi Baat’.
title: Gandi Baat
